titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the William Anthony Papers
1955-2013 (Bulk 1976-2013)
MSS 081
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Laura Newsome, 2011. Accretions processed by Nicholas Martin, 2014.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-06-08T10:44-0400

did.abstract: William Anthony is an American painter and graphic artist working in satire. This William anthony Papers primarily contain facsimiles of Anthony's work, documenting his artistic career from 1976 though 2004. There are also some original artworks, photographs of Anthony, and other personal materials.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: William Anthony is an American painter and graphic artist working in satire. Anthony was born in Ft. Monmouth, New Jersey in 1934, and grew up in Washington State. He graduated from Yale in 1958, majoring in history and taking art courses, including Josef Albers's drawing course. Shortly after graduation he moved to the San Francisco Bay Area where he studied briefly at art schools.

Anthony taught figure drawing at a commercial art school in San Francisco in 1962. This experience resulted in a his first book, A New Approach to Figure Drawing, 1965, (Crown, NY, and Odhams, 1967, London). His other books, all of satirical drawings, include Bible Stories, 1978, (The Jargon Society, Winston-Salem), Bill Anthony's Greatest Hits, (1988, The Jargon Society), and War Is Swell, 2000, (Smart Art Press, Santa Monica).
His drawings have been commissioned for Artforum, The Paris Review, Art In America, and by Andy Warhol for his magazine Interview.
The Museum of Modern Art, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Whitney Museum, the Guggenheim Museum, the Brooklyn Museum and 20 other museums include Anthony's work in their collections.
Anthony has lived in New York since 1964.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection primarily contains facsimiles of Anthony's work, documenting his artistic career from 1976 though 2004. There are also some original artworks, photographs of Anthony, and other personal materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection was arranged and described by the donor. Minor changes have been made by the archivist to improve accessibility.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The William Anthony Papers were donated to NYU's Fales Library and Special Collections by William Anthony in 1996, 2009 and 2013.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The William Anthony Papers; MSS 081; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
